title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.16.20 part 4 | 25-01-2023
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.text: Om Agyanati Miran Dhasya Gyanan Janishalakaya
Chakshurun Militam Yena Tasmai Shri Gurave Namaha
Nama Om Vishnu Padaya Krishna Preshtaya Bhutale
Shri Mate Bhakti Vedanta Swamin Nithinamine
Namaste Saraswate Deve Gauravani Pracharine
Nirvishesha Shunyavadi Pashchatya Deshatarine
Jaya Shri Krishna Chaitanya Prabhu Nityananda
Shri Advaita Gadadhara Shiva Sadhi Gauravakta Vrinda
Hare Krishna Hare Krishna Krishna Krishna Hare Hare
Hare Rama Hare Rama Rama Rama Hare Hare
Om Namo Bhagavate Vasudevaya Narayanam Namaskritya
Naram Chai Vanarottamam Deveem Saraswateem Vyasam
Tato Jayam Udi Rayet

I have lost my three legs and I am now standing on one only.

at present are you grieving for living beings because of their

so we'll continue discussing the purport so in the previous session we discussed
about what is faith in the supreme personality of godhead, what is real faith and
what is blind faith or material belief system.
They two are completely different. As I mentioned earlier, the word Shraddha that is used, that's
a beginning of Bhakti. Shraddha is the beginning of Bhakti, real faith in Krishna. That is a
beginning of Bhakti. So till one actually has got that Shraddha, the real faith in Krishna as
the Supreme Personality of Godhead, there is no question of Bhakti at all. So what passes
off as Bhakti or devotion is some sentiment, some blind faith, some belief system. Like
sometimes people ask, do you believe in God? One person may ask another person. The other
person may say, yeah, yeah, I believe in God. Somebody else may say, I don't believe in
God. So this belief system is not what we are talking about here.
When you say faith, this is different. This is completely, it is coming from the core
of the heart. It's a transformation of the heart by purification through the authorized
process of executing Bhakti, devotional service. So it is not just a mental state or it's not
an intellectual exercise.
It is actually a transformation of the heart by purification. Heart means here we are talking
of consciousness, which is a symptom of the soul, conscious symptom of the soul. So let
me continue the purport. The degradation of the human instinct begins from the mlechas
and the Chandala state of life is the last word in human degradation. Why is Prabhupada
telling this? He's telling in Kali Yuga,
the human beings degrade, become degraded in their character, in their consciousness
due to the evil influence of the age, the Kali Yuga. And what is the evil influence
of Kali Yuga? There is widespread sinful activities, particularly four kinds of sinful activities.
Characterizing this Kali Yuga, meat eating, intoxication, gambling, illicit sex. So these
four sinful activities are prominent in Kali Yuga. And it is, it is practice, it is these
sinful activities are very much prevalent among more and more people in Kali Yuga. Even
though

who are sinful who are breaking these four principles of no meat eating no intoxication
one becomes influenced and a good person a cultured person a pious person becomes sinful

like that. Somebody says, I am a Brahmin. How do you say you are a Brahmin? I was born in a Brahmin
family. Or my forefathers were very nice, first class qualified Brahmin. That's fine. Your
forefathers are first class qualified Brahmin because of which you have a good possibility
of getting trained up in first class behavior, first class qualities. Yes. But unless you get
trained and unless you actually exhibit those qualities, you are not a Brahmin. You cannot be
called a Brahmin. So, that is what Prabhupada is telling.
Never these designations as Brahmana, Chhatriya, Vaishya, Shudra, Mlecha, Yavana are never meant for
any particular community or they are not to be, these designations are not to be given based on
birth. They are based on qualifications. There is no question of birthright or community. No.
That is not the way. One can acquire the respective
number of birthrights by birthright. One can acquire the respective number of birthrights by
qualification by one's own efforts and thus the son of a Vaishnava can become a Mleksha
born in a nice Vaishnava family but by bad association by not following the principles
of Vaishnava conduct one becomes a Mleksha or the son of a Chandala can become more than
a Brahmana can become first-class Vaishnava all in terms of their association and intimate
relation with the Supreme Lord Vaishnava means one who connects with Krishna through the process of
bhakti devotional service bhakti yoga and then when the connection is established by qualification
by practice by association
by behavior by culture then even though a person by birth was not having any good
qualities or any good behavior can become qualified can exhibit all the good qualities
by training, by culture, by association develop that relationship and become a first-class
Vaishnava.

the meat eaters
the meat eaters are generally called
Mlechha's. Mlechha means meat eaters who are particular kind of meat eaters.
Prabhupada says all meat eaters are not Mlechha's. Those who accept meat in terms
of scriptural injunctions are not Mlechha's. In scripture there is a
concession given to somebody who is very much habituated to eating meat. If they
want to regulate their meat eating according to scriptural directions
because they can't totally give up eating meat immediately when they come
to know about the fact that meat eating is sinful activity because of which they
have to suffer sinful reactions. So they don't want suffering, so they have to
stop meat eating. But they can't immediately stop. They can regulate their
meat eating according to scriptural injunctions.
So in one place in the scriptures it is said meat eating is
sinful. You should not eat meat. Avoid meat eating. Now that may not be possible
for everyone on hearing such a scriptural direction or injunction. A
person cannot immediately stop because of habit.

So whatever one's choice one may eat, this is not correct understanding. There is consideration of what a person should eat. Every living being by arrangement, higher arrangement has got designated food.
Just like a cow will never eat any flesh. A tiger will never eat grass. See that designated food for tiger is the flesh of certain animals. Designated food for cow is grass.
So this is by higher arrangement in nature.
But among human beings there is no such thing.
There is a certain freedom given that you may eat different kinds of edibles.
But that is restricted to vegetables, fruits, grains, dahl, cow's milk like this. It is restricted to that for human beings.
Designated food for human beings.
Now if somebody thinks that
I will eat what I like to eat or I will eat what is good for my health.
Somebody may say for you vegetable may be okay, for me vegetable is not enough to be healthy, to develop good strength.
I require to eat some non-vegetarian food.
So that may be some consideration some people may have.
But if you have to eat meat there is restriction by which
if you follow this restriction only goat flesh, only once a month, only after sacrificing the goat to Kali.
Only to Kali, not to any Devata, not to any, not to Krishna, not to Vishnu, no.
And it must be sacrificed. There is a procedure for sacrificing.
According to Shastra.
Then that person is saved from grievous sinful reactions.
But in Kali Yuga people don't care.
For all this restriction they don't bother.
Therefore they invite sufferings of so many kind.
So that is one unfortunate situation in Kali Yuga.
I will stop here. Thank you very much. Hare Krishna.
